title.narrative: Increased accountability and responsiveness of the government to its citizens in Tanzania

description.narrative: This activity (Increased accountability and responsiveness of the government to its citizens in Tanzania) is a component of Accountability in Tanzania Programme - Phase II reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of Services' and a budget of £31,833,926. This component benefits Tanzania, and works in the following sector(s): Democratic participation and civil society, Media and free flow of information, Women's equality organisations and institutions. , with the following implementing partners: KPMG LLP. The start date is 01-04-2015 and the end date is 31-12-2022.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

description.narrative: Other General Services - General Public Service - Other General Services - other general services
Other General Services - General Public Service - Other General Services - support to civil society
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - Social Affairs - Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Aid to civil society organisations / NGOs
